website_summaries.verdict: This sturdy broom features good quality craftsmanship and durability, but it is a little heavier than other options.
pros: Handcrafted from 100% natural broom corn, with 5 rows of polytwine stitching for strength
Solid wood handle is 40" long and black
cons: Some buyers felt that the bristles on this broom were too hard and brittle
Broom is on the heavier side, which some may find tiresome to use on a large floor

customer_reviews.title: Insect nest
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the worst purchases I’ve ever made. The handle of this broom was really bent/angled and there was some kind of animal/insect nest in the broom itself. I decided this would be an outside broom only once I saw that! Too hard to send back. Purchase one at Freddie’s instead. Half the price for basically the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: KatMcL

customer_reviews.title: A must for every deck, porch, and patio
customer_reviews.text: Call me old fashioned, but I much rather sweep our deck, porch, and steps with this handy and well-made broom than listen to the abhorrent noise of a blower. It even looks attractive. It was well packed and delivered promptly.
customer_reviews.author: jyg

customer_reviews.title: This is not your plastic company's broom..
customer_reviews.text: For all you people out there still using those wimpy plastic brooms that don't actually sweep anything, this is what's known as a "real" broom. It's a broom like mom used, like grandpa used in the shed, like I used when my kids were little. It's wide, it's heavy-ish, it's got FIVE rows of strong stuff holding all those corn stalks together. This is the real deal. Did I mention it sweeps, and I mean it sweeps EVERTHING and puts it in its place. You will never need another broom.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl F.

customer_reviews.title: Solid assembly, built to last!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I've ever spent this much on a broom (on Amazon it's not much, actually), but I sure can tell the difference between this O-Cedar Broom and pretty much every other broom I've owned. This one is about 15% larger than your average drug store broom (longer handle, wider and taller bristles) and it's really solidly built. I got this for my husband's art studio where he works in plaster, and he's thrilled. He says this broom will be more thorough in cleaning up the plaster dust along with everything else. If you love this style of broom, don't bother with any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: JLGGeekTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: but actually fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Wow, who would have thought a broom could be worth reviewing? This puppy is some broom! Substantial, springy, balanced, and, hey I'm a little embarrassed to say so, but actually fun to use. Go ahead, replace that old sucker you've got now with this one and you too will be pleased. Whoever made the Harry Potter comment got it right. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: NOT a Heavy Duty Commercial Broom
customer_reviews.text: I have used this broom 2 times; one time to sweep a few dead leaves off of my composite deck and then today to sweep off grass clippings. It is the cheapest broom I have ever owned of this type. I had high hopes for durability as the store bought ones seem to wear out on one side so quickly. This broom will not even make it a few more uses to see if one side wears out. The bristles are falling out, bending, and coming undone.
customer_reviews.author: SMS

customer_reviews.title: If all brooms were still made like this, we wouldn't have an orange president
customer_reviews.text: There is a direct link between the quality of cleaning products and the quality of life. Back when these sturdy, strong, wooden brooms made with real corn were the only option, the people of the world were happy. Now that cheap plastic junk brooms are the norm, people are angry. Coincidence? I think not. Make brooms great again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: this thing is epic
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the other reviewers who've written so effusively about this broom, and can now say I share the enthusiasm. This broom is solid, well-built, gorgeous, and made me, too, want to go around sweeping things. I think it's because the darn thing is just so well made, and you just don't see that anymore. It's like a broom your grandma and grandpa had in the house back in the day that they used for the kitchen, the back porch, the shop, and the occasional light-hearted swat at wayward youths. It's definitely not something you hide in a closet. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: quadruplethreat

customer_reviews.title: STICK THICK AND HEAVY- NOT FOR PETITE FOLKS
customer_reviews.text: This broom is the highest quality one I’ve seen and will probably last you a lifetime. The bottom sweeping part is perfect. The stick though is very thick and heavy. This broom is not for petite folks, taller than me and extremely thick to hold and very heavy. Please offer a thinner, lighter one with the same bottom. I hate to be negative but just to give you an idea, you could beat someone to literal death with this stick.
customer_reviews.author: big sis

customer_reviews.title: What does it take to get a stiff broom these days?!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so it is stiffer than a Rubbermaid broom, but certainly nowhere near stiff enough for my barn. After just three uses, the bristles bend to one side. Very disappointed and grateful that I did not buy the three I needed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barney

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy at all
customer_reviews.text: As it came I started sweeping my driveway and sidewalk and a piece of the straws came out immediately. It’s very shaky and not sturdy at all for $30 it’s not worth it. I should have gotten one at the store where it would be definitely sturdier and better put together.
customer_reviews.author: Crina

customer_reviews.title: Leaks sap for some reason...
customer_reviews.text: Not loving this broom. Handle has sap on it sometimes. No idea why... the bristles come out somewhat easily. My partner instigated on getting an old school looking broom and couldn’t find anything in person so bought this on amazon. Plus it came in an enormous box - what a waste. I prefer the heavy duty plastic kind for a more thorough sweep. We have a huge cedar tree that drops needles all over our front walk and porch and this broom just doesn’t cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McCright

customer_reviews.title: Best Brooms Even!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these brooms a few months and and quickly decided I needed another for the garage. Only the three pack as available at the time so I gave the other two away. Nice, sturdy broom that actually moves the dirt and debris where you want it. When I need another broom, I will buy another one of these. Way better than anything I have found in the stores.
customer_reviews.author: tmcm

customer_reviews.title: What a marvelous broom!
customer_reviews.text: What a marvelous broom! I've used O-Cedar products for years and been satisfied with them. I especially love this typically well made broom, but with the wonderful black details. Makes the silver of the wire wrap seem to shine brighter and the tan of the bristles seem more rich. My next door neighbor already hollered over the fence "Love that broom!". I hollered back "Yeah and she flies great too!". My neighbor laughed....looked a bit nervous...but laughed...:D
customer_reviews.author: BRT

customer_reviews.title: Bristles fall out after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I only used the broom a few times and the bristles started falling out. Cheap
customer_reviews.author: Charles Farrell

customer_reviews.title: A heavy duty broom great for rugs/carpet.
customer_reviews.text: A real broom that cleans rugs and carpet very well. Heavy duty construction. So tired of cheap plastic brooms that barely work before breaking a month or two later. Strongly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Frisky Dingo

customer_reviews.title: Clean Sweep
customer_reviews.text: Even though I have a vacuum, I often use a broom. For the past 25 years, I've had synthetic brooms. They were ok, but I missed the strength of a corn broom. Why did I wait so long to get one? It slipped my mind, except when I was sweeping. But I have one now, and that's what's important. The only "complaint" I have it that this is a tall broom. I'm currently 5' 4-1/2" and this broom is a little stretch. So, I wouldn't recommend this for a very short person, but other than that, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mathlady

customer_reviews.title: Classic broom, rides well.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and does the job. Feels sturdy and lasts for years if you treat it right (store indoors and hang it up, don’t stand it on its bristles). Easy to steer and gets great mileage especially on nights with a full moon. Staff is thick enough that it doesn’t pinch if you sit on it right.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Quick

customer_reviews.title: Better than a local purchase
customer_reviews.text: Better than a local purchase. For some reason, brooms like this are hard to find in the home improvement stores. Retailers want to sell the cheaper / smaller / plastic units. I was hoping for a larger broom but it is not a disappointment. It had one cosmetic flaw but after all is said and done it is just a broom. The hand broom gives me a sense of my history and there are few things more rewarding than making a dirty floor tidy. This is what these O-Cedar brands are famous for.
customer_reviews.author: G Wheels

customer_reviews.title: Good broom but they weren't lying when they said heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a big heavy duty broom. I got it for the kitchen but it's probably more at home in a woodshop sweeping sawdust. Good broom but they weren't lying when they said heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, not great for shorter folks.
customer_reviews.text: This broom is great, we are using it for indoor hardwood floors and it works as advertised. The broom feels sturdy and well constructed, however--for my smaller stature (5'3"), it is a bit cumbersome to use as the handle is quite long and it is much weightier than the standard brooms I have previously purchased at Target or Walmart. But, this works out for me because now I can tell my 5'11" husband that he needs to sweep the house for me.
customer_reviews.author: chubbertchen

customer_reviews.title: Honestly There Are Few Brooms Like This
customer_reviews.text: I cannot stress how great this broom is! Picks up all fibers and dirt alike within a few sweeps and really puts its plastic counterpart to shame! Old school style which is really cool in my opinion, but best of all it works superiorly [indoors]!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't recommend it :-(
customer_reviews.text: Quite frankly, I expected better from O-Cedar. It's just barely okay; I will not purchase a second one for use at the office porch. When I sweep my garage, it continues to lose bristles. Most corn brooms will do that the first or second use, but I've had it for several months now.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent broom-five stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this broom. Well crafted and it sweeps better than the ones I was getting before. The handle is stout, the bristles are full and effective, and it is likely to outlast lesser brooms. Similar to buying a quality tool; it gives pleasure with each use. I tend to store it either hanging, or with the bristles up, so as to not bend the bristles out of shape. Wish it was available locally, so I did not have to recycle the big cardboard box. Good product! 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: John Comstock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one for my front porch because I wanted a broom that wasn't an eye sore to leave out on the porch. Oh my goodness... this is the best broom. I like it as much as my vaccum! I purchased another for inside the house the same day that this one came! Won't ever go back to the crappy plastic ones again!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: A good corn broom
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this particular corn broom. The one I bought four years ago is worn out. I use it on the outdoor patio to sweep acorns in the summer and I sweep snow off the walkway with it in the winter. I thought about getting a cheaper corn broom but decided against it. I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wessels

customer_reviews.title: Broom - sweeps perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love a good broom - my last broom was used outside where the bristles got warn down - so the new broom in the house is wonderful in the house. I even put a note on the broom for in the house use only. Great for indoor and outdoor - however outdoor the bristles will get warn down.
customer_reviews.author: dbm23j

customer_reviews.title: Why Did I Buy So Many Crappy Brooms?
customer_reviews.text: Bought a series of cheap brooms with plastic handles, synthetic bristles, and just poor quality for no other reason than I didn’t think doing research on a good broom was important. So I spent $60 on a bunch of garbage and this thing is half the price and I can already tell it will last for years. Sometimes you can’t improve on a classic. It’s a sweeping beast.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Carlin

customer_reviews.title: Study built to last, can pass on the open road plenty of power!
customer_reviews.text: Great broom , good speed handles well , wife commutes to work on this baby , you can have those foreign jobs we like American transportation!
customer_reviews.author: S Mann

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing! Thirty bucks for this??!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I did read previous reviews; I guess I wanted one so badly, I had to try it for myself. Just look at the poor review with pictures. Mine looks just as bad. Definitely returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Zora

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very large and sturdy. Definitely a quality item! The corn bunch is very thick and firm, and takes a bit of pressure to flex, but works well outside which was my purpose. I was also using this to sweep dust from drywall taping and sanding. Works surprisingly well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... have bought from O-Cedar and they are definitely our favorite. They are heavy duty and well-built
customer_reviews.text: This is the third broom that we have bought from O-Cedar and they are definitely our favorite. They are heavy duty and well-built. We tried other brooms over the years, but none can compare to the quality of these. You pay a little more, but they outlast several of the cheaper ones and they will more than pay for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: SGen

customer_reviews.title: Great Broom
customer_reviews.text: I love this broom. It's everything I love in a sturdy heavy duty broom. I love that it was delivered right to my door and I therefore I didn't have to make a trip to the hardware store to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Anon O. Mous

customer_reviews.title: THIS BROOM ROCKS ITS VERY HEAVY AND SWEEPS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This is not a light weight broom its heavy the handle is thick and the straw is great it gets everything and it would make a great Halloween Witch broom too.hahaha.
customer_reviews.author: Nina273

customer_reviews.title: handle too large
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice sturdy broom for using outside. This one would fit the bill I suppose, except for the fact that the handle is too large. It hurts my hand to sweep with it and even my husband doesn't find it comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: seafoodsue

customer_reviews.title: Love these brooms !
customer_reviews.text: These Industrial Brooms are difficult to find unless you can locate a janitorial supply. I was thrilled to find these brooms. They come in 3 for the order. I am using one in my house -one in the basement and one in the garage. Perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Steger

customer_reviews.title: Meh broom.
customer_reviews.text: The bristles are not very firm. They are soft. Like a “sensitive” line toothbrush for senior citizens. For the money, I’d expect a bit more firmness. The debris on the ground is looking up at me an laughing, saying “is that all you got?”. And the handle is too thick. But I likely will keep it and use it (and not return it). Because hey, it’s just a broom.
customer_reviews.author: sdesign9

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor/outdoor rugs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for outdoor sweeping. I have outdoor rugs on my deck and this really helped during springtime cleanup. It's heavy-duty. I would recommend taping the handle where you naturally hold for sweeping to avoid blisters. The handle is large and sturdy. Store straw side up to avoid bending as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S

customer_reviews.title: What a broom should be.
customer_reviews.text: This is like the broom i used 50 years ago and it’s still a great tool. Used daily.
customer_reviews.author: bob norris

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my grandma now she lifts more than me.
customer_reviews.text: My grandma will only use old corn husk type brooms and so when her old one gave out I got her this one. It’s sturdy and well made if not a little on the heavy end. She can use it alright though and likes it. She also says it doubles as a home defense weapon so props to O-Cedar.
customer_reviews.author: Kameron

customer_reviews.title: Best broom design
customer_reviews.text: Finally showing some wear after years of sweeping outdoor patio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Nice broom for porch
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quality broom that I like to use for outside, particularly on our deck and porch. It does a great job at gathering the debris and is strong enough to sometimes “flick” the debris off of the deck under the railing.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I first discovered your broom when I went to the dump to drop off some wood no longer needed. There was a broom there to clean up what ever mess you make. I used the broom to sweep up. My daughter and I both loved the way it did the job. Asked a worker there where they got the broom but he did not know. When I saw it on Amazon I bought one for my daughter for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Grodi

customer_reviews.title: Black paint leaves marks wherever it touches
customer_reviews.text: Love the broom itself because its sturdy and pretty. Ive had it for a couple weeks now, and I have noticed a huge defect, in that the broom handle, since it is black, rubs off on any surface it touches. That means that when I sweep my dining room, and accidentally bump the wall with the broom, it leaves a huge black scuff on my wall. Im not happy
customer_reviews.author: jessica wasmuth

customer_reviews.title: Best riding broom ever
customer_reviews.text: When ever I have to have a new broom my kids say I am buying a new ride. Well, this ride is always the best. OCedar makes the BEST straw brooms! Mine last at least a couple of years. LOVE this broom
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Great Broom! No shedding and seems well made. Not sure why some said it was too heavy? The handle is thicker than average broom handles, but it's not uncomfortable to use. The corn bristles have a little give to them while sweeping. Works great for outdoor porches and decks.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Strope

customer_reviews.title: This is a very sturdy broom just like were available in the 50's
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy broom just like were available in the 50's. Nice thick handle, comfy for old gnarly hands. When dirt sees it standing on my porch, it runs away! Very well made. Back "in the day" the brooms cost about @2.00 each. Gasoline cost $0.18. I'm sure I will have to take it in off the porch in October to keep the neighborhood witches from flying off with it. Keep smilin!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Broom Handle Damaged - UPDATE: O-Cedar Provided Replacement
customer_reviews.text: After contacting O-Cedar, they provided a replacement broom free of charge, tremendous service on their part and were very easy to deal with. Original Review Below: Received the broom with the handle badly scuffed/marked up. It doesn't affect the functionality of the broom but it is just incredibly frustrating to pay this much for a broom and receive a damaged item. Will make me second-guess ordering any O-Cedar products again online.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive broom, works well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent broom. I bought this broom to sweep the dirt and leaves off my deck. It's perfect for that. I think it may work less well indoors because the bristles are very stiff, but this is perfect for quickly flinging debris back to where it belongs....in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie Powers

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Brooms
customer_reviews.text: These are good brooms, but the corn brooms I used to get from Sam's Club were cheaper and stiffer. These are stiffer than the cheap ones I've bought at big box stores, but still I wish were a little bit stiffer. The brooms are very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Rutablavsky

customer_reviews.title: Corn Broom
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific broom. I use it outside on the deck around the pool and it does a great job. The handle is long and heavy duty. It’s very well made.
customer_reviews.author: FBG

customer_reviews.title: Large & sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We need to wear it in a bit. Very large with larger diameter handle. The bristles are very sturdy, and appears that it will last a long time. A little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: Great Broom, Terrible Delivery, Not Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Very nice broom. Delivered to my driveway in the pouring rain. "Unacceptable Amazon Delivery Person" strikes again. The broom is fine but it could have been much worse.
customer_reviews.author: Mattlock

customer_reviews.title: The best broom available!
customer_reviews.text: Yikes - the price! But ... they are worth it. I am as old as the mountains, so I will not use inferior plastic brooms from Lowe's or Home Depot! I refuse!
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Deeds

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy broom
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy broom, especially compared to the terrible plastic one I was suffering along with for so many years. The handle is almost too big and heavy (it keeps falling over and scaring the cat). It works very nicely and does not show the dirt as much as my old one did.
customer_reviews.author: R. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Too big and heavy
customer_reviews.text: It has a thick handle and heavy thick broom brushes. It would be perfect for a 6'3" man, but is really too big for a small woman.
customer_reviews.author: Xenophon

customer_reviews.title: Old school is the best school
customer_reviews.text: This broom is sturdy and will live long days sweeping concrete. The strands are the right amount of tough and elastic. With some training you can propel dry leaves so far you can clean your driveway in five minutes. Green natural way of taking care of dry leaves and debris. My grandmother would be proud of me.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasios V.

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: If you know how to use a Coen broom this is great... if not, it takes a little while to get used to... but hey it is nice to have something sturdy in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Think Outside The Box
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for broom. -3 stars for using wasteful big box for shipping. There must be a better way.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Broom Nirvana
customer_reviews.text: This broom is exactly as described. Perfect for outdoor use, which is our intent. Solid, robust, well done!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Reiff

customer_reviews.title: Quality without any gimmicks
customer_reviews.text: Just a good ole fashion brook. I marked 1 star of Ease of Use because I am the one who has to sweep. No batteries, no AC motor and no auto pilot like Roomba; but it stores nicely.
customer_reviews.author: MrkS

customer_reviews.title: The Kind of Broom You Fly On
customer_reviews.text: I think this broom could support a large witch. That being said, it's pretty heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Cup o' Jojo

customer_reviews.title: Love this broom!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this broom as a prop for my witch Halloween costume, but have since used it to sweep floors, and now I use it to sweep out our garage. It's sturdy, but soft enough to move the debris. Just right!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee

customer_reviews.title: Good Broom
customer_reviews.text: Stiff enough to sweep snow off my stairs. Sturdy enough that the wet snow didnd damage the broom.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy broom
customer_reviews.text: I got this broom to replace one that we keep on our front porch which had deteriorated from many years of use. This broom is very high quality and an excellent replacement for the old one. I expect this broom will give us many years of excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Ron in Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: This is the Real Thing!
customer_reviews.text: Before plastic became the predominant material used for almost everything, straw brooms like this one, sturdy- efficient, and durable- allowed us to sweep quickly with less effort. Lame plastic brooms cannot measure up to this fine quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Perry R. Callas

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey, But I love this broom. I hate those plastic brooms! This broom spreads out and grabs EVERYTHING. Making it so much easier to sweep up big messes. I could see this broom lasting a very long time! And I'm so happy I got it.
customer_reviews.author: GreenCowLand

customer_reviews.title: Bristles breaking off
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it but once - bristles breaking off already!
customer_reviews.author: john h.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Wish the broom had a hole in the handle to hang on back of closet door. Also, thought price was one thing but paid considerable more. Not sure if I read it wrong or I was charged wrong, however we've never paid $30 for a broom before
customer_reviews.author: arthur conway

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction but not ideal for inside use
customer_reviews.text: The major complaint on this broom is that it doesn't pick up all of the particles on our floor. It looks nice and seems like it could last a long time, it jut isn't a precise functioning broom for inside use. I could see it being useful for outside sweeping.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar L

customer_reviews.title: Good wood handle, coarse bristles
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for a real wood handle, a little thicker than need be. The bristles are coarser and stiffer than need be, so it is best for sweeping heavy stuff. Probably just bought the wrong broom, but glad there still are wood and corn brooms.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Reid

customer_reviews.title: This is A “Real” Broom
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an old-fashioned corn broom with no plastic parts. This broom has a sturdy wooden handle and is substantial. I anticipate it will last for years. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: A solid broom that my mom use to use. I use this in the barn and appreciate the weight and feel of a decent broom again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: best buy
customer_reviews.text: I like the shaft that is a heavy duty one.
customer_reviews.author: john j.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use
customer_reviews.text: I am "that person" who will pay someone else to assemble furniture and dread having to assemble toys. This juicer was easy to assemble. A product needs it to be simple and this juicer is easy. I have no frame of reference to compare it to other juicers but so far and it is good for my needs. I liked having customer service contact me via email to acknowledge they received the mailed warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Been around over hundreds of years for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: This is the good old dependable broom I grew up with. Natural, not plastic:synthetic. It biodegradeds when discarded. It works. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: LTH

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with broken strands sticking out and the interior knot exposed. I tried to form it back together, but it looks kind of mangled even though it should sweep okay
customer_reviews.author: avidreader

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the old fashioned things get the job done better and this broom is one of those things
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the old fashioned things get the job done better and this broom is one of those things! It makes sweeping the floors easy again and gathers dust and direct better than a swifter or nylon broom LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Simone

customer_reviews.title: I love the 2 pak
customer_reviews.text: I love the 2 pak.. use one inside and outside/garage.. these are made of very good quality and cleans quick and efficiently. Way better than the new bristle brooms on the market... love these old school corn brooms. My garage has never looked so clean!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: Favorite part is the THICK sturdy handle. I love This style vs a cheap plastic broom. I left It on the porch and everyone thought it was part of the fall decor.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: A new broom sweeps clean
customer_reviews.text: These are tough to find these days. A bit heavy but well made. Corn brooms have stiff enough bristles to clean carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great broom!
customer_reviews.text: This is a hefty broom. I really like it but beware it has a thicker handle than the average and the broom itself is larger. I liked the thinner handle for my hands but this broom will last a long time !
customer_reviews.author: jcqln01_hikes

customer_reviews.title: Edible poly twine?
customer_reviews.text: We left the broom outside. Within a week animals destroyed the broom by eating and destroying the poly twine holding the straw together. Unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Siegal

customer_reviews.title: Already breaking down
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was going to be good but the brissles are already falling out.
customer_reviews.author: LZ

customer_reviews.title: It's a great broom!
customer_reviews.text: A good old-fashioned sturdy broom. There was some shedding when I first used it but rushes are often shed the first time you use a corn broom. Will come back when this one eventually wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Typhon Set

customer_reviews.title: NO GREAT SHAKES
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a good, sturdy-bristled broom for outdoor use, do not purchase this one. It’s wimpy and not worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality corn broom. I have purchased many from the box stores and they did not last long. Even though I just received it, I can tell the quality of the broom is well made (In the USA).
customer_reviews.author: Melonie Graves

customer_reviews.title: Not good for every day inside use.
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy and the straw breaks off. Too much Trouble to return. It's probably better to use for cleaning outside.
customer_reviews.author: pat r

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Favorite broom ever, and no splinters in the handle either. I just used it to brush snow off my patio and it did a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Best broom ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the most substantial broom I have ever touched. Not kidding. From the heavy stick to the stiff bristles, this broom. means business. “The broom of the system,” indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good. Living it every time I use it
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I am buying this. I got one for my house and one for my boyfriend's. I love it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Good broom
customer_reviews.text: I like the broom a lot but I think the price is too high. It works great for my garage and it is a very strong wood handle
customer_reviews.author: Tara G

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Broom
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made broom. They last a very long time. It's not especially light and thought price was a bit high.
customer_reviews.author: MedUSA

customer_reviews.title: This is It!
customer_reviews.text: It may seem silly but I've been looking for a decent broom for a long time. Just an old fashioned broom. This is it!!! Love this broom.
customer_reviews.author: Sandini

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second order for this broom. It was a reorder of a purchase made from this same seller in 01//2017. Reorder was lighter in weight and broom head about 2 inches smaller. Packaging on the broom was the same. I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hiatt

customer_reviews.title: Durable, quality and fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased! I just threw my gross, bent little plastic broom with the splayed bristles away! handle is too thick for my clip on dustpan, but oh, well. This is one hell of an upgrade. Sturdy, effective, witchy. Shipping was speedy as well.
customer_reviews.author: kristen c.

customer_reviews.title: I love this broom...
customer_reviews.text: I almost rode this broom in the snow when I was trying to clear my steps and drive. Great broom...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just a great broom.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect broom for me. The height is spot on might be a little short for some, a little tall for others. Feels like if I want this broom will be around for at least another 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Enstein

customer_reviews.title: This is what a broom was designed to be.
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I think to buy this broom years ago, instead of the inferior junky brooms at the store? This is a great broom!! Good, solid wood handle -- not a flimsy one that screws two pieces of metal together. This is THE definition of a "broom". I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this old fashion broom, works great for my garage
customer_reviews.author: Randall W.Hier

product_meta.title: O-Cedar Heavy Duty Commercial 100% Corn Broom with Solid Wood Handle
product_meta.description: Size:Pack - 1This O-Cedar Heavy Duty corn Broom is made with 100% natural Broom corn and is great for both indoor and outdoor jobs. It is the perfect Broom For sweeping garage, driveways, patios and decks. Built to last with 5 rows of reinforced polytwine stitching.
feature_bullets: Made with the highest quality 100% natural Broom corn
Reinforced with 5 rows of polytwine stitching
Sturdy enough to use on commercial jobs
